Pan Pacific Perth
8.1 Excellent
Based on 1063 reviews

The room was big and spacious. The view on the 19th floor was beautiful. I love the couch in the room.

Everything was clean and the bathroom was spotless which was fantastic. Check in was done by a trainee but she was friendly and welcoming. The pool was past the lobby and might be weird if you think of wearing your bathers under a bathrobe. They do have changing rooms there where you might be able to change into bathers. The gym was big and well equipped. There were a few of the same machines which means you don't have to wait to use a machine. I did unfortunately run into unpleasant guests with kids that were being a nuisance in the gym. Like using the weights rope as a slingshot, causing the weights to slam loudly, and kicking the fitball into the mirror and shouting and running around. One thing about the bathroom was the water pressure is very weak. And you have to call service one to get some slippers and toothbrush kit and razor. It took them under 30mins to bring it to me. Overall, it was a good experience.

Show more
Eiko , Singapore
The Point Brisbane - Hotel
8.8 Excellent
Based on 340 reviews

I decided to stay a night at this hotel after I arrived back after my long flight as I couldn't be bothered to drive all the way to the Gold Coast.

This hotel is located at Kangaroo point which has a Suburban feel, with a short ferry ride to the city which is free. There is also some bars, restaurants and cafes which are walking distance from hotel and good views of Story bridge and city skyline. This 5 star hotel is pretty good value for money where it has free Car park for guests and have a choice of dry cleaning or do it yourself laundry for free, not many 5 star hotels in Brisbane have free car parking for guests. The food and the breakfast at the restaurant was nice and you can order snacks while you're at the pool. The staff were friendly and helpful and it has a small business feel more than a big hotel chain. I will stay at this hotel every time I arrive back at Brisbane.

Show more
Gordon , Australia
The Crossley Hotel
8.1 Excellent
Based on 332 reviews

Since I was at Melbourne on business most of the time I was out of the hotel, but every time I went back the room was nicely clean and tidy.

One thing I liked is the fact the cleaning staff would keep the things were I left them instead of putting them back to their default position, such as pillows, cushions, tissue box, etc. Internet access was smooth, but it would automatically disconnect every 30 minutes (for security reasons I believe), and then reconnect upon extending the connection time.

Show more
Alfonso , Peru
Esplanade Hotel Fremantle – by Rydges
8 Very good
Based on 644 reviews

Our 5 day stay was comfortable. But hotel does not provide basic necessities sa toothbrushes, toothpastes and slippers.

We had to quickly go back to Coles at the train station to buy them. If we had known that earlier, we would have avoided any additional walkings since we walked to the hotel from the train station before checkin. By the way, The double bed in room 155 is very springy. Both of us have slight giddiness before we could fall asleep. We had to stay very still in it.

Show more
Allan , Singapore
Fraser Suites Perth
8.5 Excellent
Based on 908 reviews

It was very good place to stay. It close with hay st for shopping and riverside. It has street parking for free from 6pm to 8am.

So if you have plan to rent car, it will help you to reduce cost. It has direct bus from airport T1 to hotel. The bus stop only accross the street. I brougt Stokke pram and very big suitcase so it will help you also because you could't use normal taxi. The staffs are good and very helpful. Room is good with dish wash machine, but no washing machine. I rented a studio room for 4 days with no brakfast. It close with Duotone coffee which just 10 min walk with good coffee to get. If you like to run in the morning, it will easy to catch 5km to 10km with beautiful scenery of swan river. You will catch 30min to hay st by walk to shopping center in downtown. I like the Aurora Tea from the room as complement. It is good specially for the lemon ginger. I didn't use the gym etc because iwas very less time. I left hotel in the morning and went to subburb and went back hotel lat. So i won't comment for that

Show more
widya , Indonesia
Amora Jamison Hotel
8.7 Excellent
Based on 858 reviews

It's definitely a great location with airport transfer tram 20 min to airport and 10 min walk to circular Bay.

But the hotel might wanna review on it's service and the human approach to win more guests over. Mineral water and snacks were chargeable but were placed there without price card and we have to call and ask. Similar for basic amenities like tooth brush and so on. Had our room's washroom facing SunCorp office so have to keep the bind down at all times. There's still a delivery charge of $6 for room service, wonder if they will waive it off if I were to collect it myself? 😏

Show more
Joyce , Singapore
Shangri-la Hotel
8.7 Excellent
Based on 1499 reviews

You can't go wrong with Shangri-la! Expectations fully met with the gorgeous views from our Deluxe Opera House city view room.

We lost our way from Wynyard station due to wrong instructions from the attendant seeing that we had luggage with us. As a result, we didn't get on to York Street and went up hill, down hill, round about to find the hotel. Be careful of the steep slope to get back to the hotel from Circular Quay, might not be the best location for those less mobile, elderly or little ones, especially when travelling with luggage.

Show more
L , Singapore
Radisson Blu Hotel Sydney
8.9 Excellent
Based on 472 reviews

This was our first visit to Australia, and we lucked out! Breakfast in the Lady Fairfax Room was a superb start to our days of sightseeing and hiking.

The hotel is only steps away from the Wynard Station, and a few minutes walk from Circular Quay and the Botanical Gardens. The Rocks, Sidney Opera, and Darling Harbour are also within easy walking distance. Best of all, the staff could not have been more helpful or polite. Our doorman even had a water bottle and towel ready for me each morning when I returned from my run. When we visit Sydney again, we plan to stay at the Radisson Blu Hotel again - we travel a lot, and we are convinced there can be no hotel better than Radisson Blu. Enjoy!

Show more
William , United States
Rydges World Square
8 Very good
Based on 1295 reviews

We stayed only one night and it was extremely disappointing. As soon as we got out from the lift to our room on Level 14, the smell was absolutely disgusting, smelled like vomitting whilst housekeeping was around doing their cleaning.

Even when they left, the aweful smell was still present. We all felt sick, I think they have a problem with their smelling sense seriously. In addition, the only view from the room we had was nothing than the rear side of another grey building, that was it! EXTREMELY disappointing for the exorbitant price I paid. NEVER again!

Show more
Lorianne , Mauritius
Metro Hotel Marlow Sydney Central
7.5 Very good
Based on 3070 reviews

Check in was easy, however I'm glad we only stayed for a bit at this hotel as a resting stop for our luggage before our late flight as opposed to staying the night.

It's enough space for two people in the twin bed option but I noticed after the cleaning crew left our floor there was a huge chemical smell that seeped through the walls. I got a bit light headed and gladly stepped out to have dinner. I mentioned it to the front desk, but I am not sure if they followed through as I checked out. Also bear in mind the walls are thin, we heard some folks having couple time if you know what I mean. The hotel is located in Haymarket which is a bustling place with convenience stores, cafes, restaurants, and the Central train station.

Show more
corie , United States
Hyatt Regency Sydney
8.2 Excellent
Based on 659 reviews

Once I got to the hotel and checked in I was very happy location, food and service was great with a comfy bed I'll go back again.

The only negative was dealing with staff on the phone calls before hand leading up not understanding or helpful which made me uneasy. Note that I never got to speak to front desk even when I ask to be transferred I was dealing with people off site. This creates a bad relationship, if I ring a hotel I want to speck to people working in that hotel. The staff at the hotel itself were more than helpful and professional.

Show more
Megan , Australia
The Hotel Windsor
8.5 Excellent
Based on 606 reviews

I asked for, twice, in emails non allergy pillows for my asthmatic daughter, when we arrived there were feather pillows in the room.

I requested in the same email that the room be dark and very quiet and found that we were put in a room right next to the elevator, not only elevator noises day and night but people talking outside our room. Terrible location in the hotel. Why would a 5 star hotel staff not know this is a mistake. No milk in room, why? The guest in the room above was very heavy footed, at 5 am in the morning of two of our three nights. They thumped around the room for about 2 hours each morning, the boards of the floor creaked. The hotel really does need to be upgraded to modern standards.

Show more
Linda , Australia
Q1 Resort and Spa
8.3 Excellent
Based on 1294 reviews

You can't beat the location and the staff here, superb. My only suggestion would be to update the bed in our room - felt like it was probably the original bed that was sold with the apartment 10 years ago.

It was ok, but for a place like this I would've expected something a bit more modern and plush (it was innersprung, could be pillow top). Will still come back though.

Show more
Adam , New Zealand
Travelodge Hotel Sydney
7.5 Very good
Based on 3298 reviews

We didn't have a great night's sleep owing to very firm beds and troublesome climate control; It was there on the wall but your input temperature was only 'accepted' for about 30 mins before it defaults back to standard setting which we found uncomfortably warm.

So this was a saga throughout the night with the added bonus that the climate control has a super bright touch screen that would light up the room when activated and disturb my partner (or me). And on it went... as each of us woke up hot, tried to adjust it, and woke the other with the light...

Show more
James , Australia
Watermark Hotel and Spa
8.3 Excellent
Based on 1717 reviews

I have enjoyed staying here on many occasions but this time had a different less satisfactory stay. No mention prior to booking that we had to pay $20 per day for parking.

No glassed in room . No mention room would not have mini bar..restaurant buffet price increased but food offering less than before with only 1 type of meat. We had a dirty Towel left in bathroom prior to our check in so room was not cleanned properly. Pool is small. We booked for 3 people hover only 2 bathtowels. Please pick yourself up to the standard we enjoyed before thanks

Show more
Wayne , Australia
Swissotel Sydney
8.6 Excellent
Based on 1274 reviews

The hotel did not offer the option to pay in cash in local currency at the point of checking-in although there is a note in booking confirmation which says "Payment for this booking will be collected by the property".

The room charges were instead charged to the credit card and it turns out to be more expensive due to the conversion rate and unfavourable exchange rate imposed by the credit card company.

Show more
FM , Singapore
Metro Aspire Hotel Sydney
8.5 Excellent
Based on 219 reviews

we had 5 persons and had booked one twin room and one double room with extra bed (with 30% extra charges on top for an extra bed) via agoda.

however, during check in, the lobby manager with very rude attitude spoke to us that they will only give us one twin room and one double room and will not provide any extra bed in the double room. he said we could just stay in the sofa placed in the room and told us the only way to fight for our right is to negotiate with agoda but not their hotel !!! the phillippno hotel lobby manager (may be) had delivered a very very bad attitude towards us and no greeting all the time during our stay. finally, we insisted our booking for a double bed + extra bed room to accommodate 3 of us in one room, and finally the man gave us a room with 2 double bed but with a very dark face in return. we will never stay in this hotel again and would definitely not recommended to anyone.

Show more
YUK , China
The Langham Melbourne Hotel
9 Excellent
Based on 399 reviews

It was a lovely stay, the staff made the stay much more pleasant. I thought the club lounge was a bit dowdy - it needs some updating, the furniture looked worn.

The rooms were nice and quiet, but I felt it was overpriced for what you got. However, overall our stay was very pleasant and the staff (all except a lady on the front desk on our arrival, who bordered on being quite rude, before we realised we could check in through the club lounge and then did so), were helpful, and really made our stay more enjoyable.

Show more
Collette , Australia
Brady Hotels Central Melbourne
8.5 Excellent
Based on 600 reviews

Late Night shift staff were really kind & helpful. We forgot one of our belongings at the airport. We tried to call the airline offices both in Bangkok and Melbourne but no one picked up our calls.

The staff helped us call the airport's lost and found and also called a taxi for us. We're really grateful to them. Morning staff is also friendly and breakfast was nice. The hotel is located in good location - just few minutes walk to tram stop. Room is clean but a bit cold. we tried to set temperature at 27 but it was automatically back to 23 again. Overall, it's value for money. If we have a chance to visit Melbourne again, we difinitely stay here.

Show more
Tichaporn , Thailand
Great Southern Hotel Melbourne
7.4 Very good
Based on 3249 reviews

Staff at the front desk are so unfriendly, can't even smile or say hello when we're walking pass the front desk and they were rude.

If you ask for their help or assistance, they will show you how to assist yourself. We ask to call for a taxi for early morning pickup, they will ask you to walk down the street to the taxi stand. and When we ask them to look after our luggage for a while we go to next door convenient store, they ask for $2 for a single luggage. When we ask for internet usage at their provided computer, they will ask $1 for 10 minutes. and 50 Cent for printing. Terrible services for the "Great" Hotel. Yes over priced WiFi as well! This is not 4 star quality. Period.“Not Great At All”

Show more
Muhammad , Malaysia
Hilton Sydney
8.6 Excellent
Based on 1221 reviews

You pay for the location which is wonderful, right in the middle of the city with good access if arriving by car.

Parking is expensive at $76 per night but that is what you pay to park in the middle of a city. The rooms are small but functional and clean and the bed is the comfortable Hilton beds everyone knows and loves with a pillow menu which I love having access to. Being right in the middle of the city means you have easy access to everything with the QVB right across the road. We had breakfast included in our stay and it was OK, nothing special just your standard buffet which I found disappointing for a 5 star hotel, it served the purpose of breakfast with nothing special to speak of. If you can get a discounted stay it is definitely worth a night or two.

Show more
Martine , Australia
Grace Hotel
8.5 Excellent
Based on 1123 reviews

Wonderful location, excellent food and good rooms. The only complaint I had was my shower. My shower sat in a bath which had it's lip about 2+ feet off the floor.

Getting in and out was very difficult. However this was my only low point (or high point as the case may be, bad pun, I know). It was a lovely place to stay and I thoroughly enjoyed it.

Show more
Trista , Australia
Beachcomber Resort Surfers Paradise
6.9 Good
Based on 478 reviews

Overall the room is good, great seaview studio room, good location near beach and shopping area. Supermarket is just 5min walk.

However, staying 3 nights there only provided 2 towels n floormat. Stated on paper that no housekeeping will be offered during the stay. Extra towels will be charged. Rubbish got to throw yourself in basement rubbish chute else will be charged. Also.. do take note that checkout time is 10am! extra hour is chargeable. Service of the 2 lady staff is bad. Initially i checked into a room and was given a room with dirty and stained bed and sofa and with no curtains/blinds! i was pretty upset about the curtains coz the sun was shinning through the full length glass into the bedroom. i saw the room nxt to me has curtains so i know this room got no curtains. i went down and asked if we can get the curtains up? the staff told me "i dont know anything." well... and she said i gota wait till 3 days later will they be able to get a maintanence guy to come and fix it. i stand there and really give a reluctant look to her. i almost wanted to change hotel!! after hogging her for about 10min then she told me got another available room. pass me key and asked me to go up n check myself. well lucky i did. and a got a better room.with curtains!

Show more
Po , Singapore
Pegasus Apartment Hotel
8.2 Excellent
Based on 1744 reviews

Everything went smoothly during our 1 Day stay at Pegasus. The check-in process was fast maybe due to off-peak hours and we will served by 3 counter staff concurrently.

The rooms were cleaned and facility was well maintained. Location wise is good for travellers who like Victoria Market, just a stone throw away... Most importantly, we had a good night sleep here.

Show more
Lay , Singapore
Rhapsody Resort
9.1 Exceptional
Based on 121 reviews

We had a 1bedroom with the ocean view. We did not expect it to be that good but when we opened the room door we actually were thrilled by the stunning beach view by the wide window in the living room.

Nice view from the bedroom also. The hotel is new and clean. We stayed for 2 nights and paid $270 which is very good price. Although the location is a little bit far from the main street (10-15mins walk). Highly recommended

Show more
Oanh , Vietnam
Hotel Jen Brisbane
8.4 Excellent
Based on 803 reviews

Pretty clean, spacious rooms, location is ok, being near Roma Train Station. However, there are lacking in a few areas, especially there is no in room slippers, no refills of mineral water daily (apparently only given 2 bottles free for first night, told by the front desk), no replenishment of toothbrush.

Didnt expect this from Hotel Jen (a chain by shangrila). Buffet breakfast was good, with many choices of fresh juice. Had dinner once at Nest, pretty okay, nothing much to choose from? If u don take spicy food, probably u are left with minimal choices. Could have been a better experience.

Show more
Edwin , Malaysia
Sydney Hotel CBD
7.7 Very good
Based on 570 reviews

I stayed here for 6 nights & was quite satifisfied with my stay. The room was quite small but comfortable enough.

All amenities were provided and the staff were friendly. In terms location, it is right in the CBD area with 2 main subway stations closeby. Public bus were also easily accessible, many restaurant nearby and Woolworths supermarket was just across the street. The only downside was the loud sound (especially friday-sat) coming from the pub nearby. Some people might find it a little disturbing. All in all, everything was fine. Would love to stay here again if i ever come back to Sydney.

Show more
Nur , Malaysia
Megaboom City Hotel
8.4 Excellent
Based on 405 reviews

Being a first timer to Sydney, I went through the reviews of several hotels near the Sydney Landmarks and found Megaboom with really good reviews especially its location and chose it, and it lived beyond my expectations.

I was surprised with the clean new hotel in the centre of the city, close to QVB, the metro station, Darling Harbour, Restaurants and shopping and above all inexpensive. Rooms may be small but it serves the purpose of a city hotel for tourists and business travellers. Would recommend to anyone looking for an excellent hotel at a cheap price. Will go back to Megaboom next time.

Show more
RAVI , India
The Star Gold Coast
8.3 Excellent
Based on 900 reviews

I traveled with my sister, stayed in one of the new rooms which was fabulous. We ate in the new garden room which was delicious n service was wonderful.

A little disappointed no music was playing in the bar areas on the Thursday night. We didn't receive any house keeping service to freshen our room up and we had stayed for two nights. There was a great room service menu which we throughly enjoyed. I recommend the club sandwich and chips followed by a chocolate milkshake.

Show more
Gael , Australia
Atlantis Hotel Melbourne
8 Very good
Based on 1738 reviews

I purely like this hotel for the location.. It's close to every amenity I needed, Skybus, train, tram, Coles & pharmacy.

. Plus the lovely restaurant next door, Il Sole.. Breakfast is a basic continental which was adequate. The room itself is plain but clean. Although I think the daily cleaning staff need a little refresher in how to make a bed.. I wouldn't bother with a city view either because the windows are so dirty you can't see out of them. Would I stay here again, yes! But purely because of the location!!

Show more
Melinda , Australia
Shangri-la Hotel, The Marina Cairns
8.5 Excellent
Based on 628 reviews

I stayed only one night so my sampling of the hotel's features was limited. The staff were very helpful and well informed, the room was spacious and well laid out and the interior pool and surrounding space were attractive.

However the entire place felt old and tired, the hotel itself was lackluster feeling. The shopping arcade attached seem deserted, with a good fraction of the shopfronts empty. The hotel is old (built in the 80's) and only now is it being renovated, with around half the rooms done. I stayed in one of the unrenovated rooms and it was not in good repair. The two other Shangri-La's I have stayed at have had much better decor, bedding and all the fixtures and fittings were in very good repair, and so this hotel does not come anywhere near the standards of other properties of this brand. However this is not a criticism unique to the Shangri-La in Cairns; I also stayed at the Pullman International and that too was worn and in not the best repair.

Show more
Paul , United Kingdom
Desert Gardens Hotel
7.6 Very good
Based on 339 reviews

Very effective transport from Ayers Rock - but room was not ready ( we came 2:30 and guaranteed time was 3 o'clock).

Since we had a booked a "sunset" tour we did not get our room in time for the tour - however we got a room to change. Searching up budget hotels to stay in Sydney but not hoping to go for backpackers? This place really was an excellent choice! Only a minute walk away from the bus stop to the city that comes every 10 to 15 minutes.

Also buses back to the place were available even till 3AM in the morning on Friday and Saturday. Journey took me only 15 minutes with bus and about 7 to 10 minutes with private car or taxi. The place was splendid! The rooms were so clean, beautiful gardens, kitchen with full equipments to use, free fast Wi-Fi, very clean toilet even tho you had to share, hot water system during the cold nights in Sydney, but most of all, the owner John is really helpful and friendly! I must say, rating this place for 5 star, where you will have almost anything you need and paying only with a 1 star price from $70 a night, why paying too much for a 3 star hotel in the city? This place is just like a home away from home.

This is a great hotel - close to town, opposite the water (which you cant really see but immediately accessible when you walk down the driveway), and quiet! It is an older style house (query 1910s?) which has a number of rooms, a sitting room, meals area etc.

Parking is available at the back of the building or down on the street. The restaurant was closed for winter when we were there. The continental breakfast was plentiful and good. The management were friendly and helpful and had some good suggestions. The rooms were a little tired ('80s period decor?), but warm and cosy and clean. The continental breakfast was included, and was in a large but cosy dining room overlooking the garden. I would be very happy staying here again.

We stayed on the 55th floor and the view was spectacular overlooking the river and the bay. 1 bedroom apartment was on the small side but definitely sufficient. The apartments are well appointed, comfortable and clean, the staff are courteous and helpful. Parking is easy and not expensive compared to other hotels, Chatswood Chase shopping mall is just across the street and it is a very short walk to the larger Westfield Chatswood and the main shopping/dining area of Chatswood.
